name.description: The name of the cluster, unique within the project and location.

location.description: The location (region or zone) in which the cluster master will be created, as well as the default node location.

initial_node_count.description: The number of nodes to create in this cluster's default node pool. In regional or multi-zonal clusters, this is the number of nodes per zone. If you're using `Node Pool` resources with no default node pool, you'll need to set this to a value of at least 1, alongside setting `Remove Default Node Pool` to true.

remove_default_node_pool.description: If true, deletes the default node pool upon cluster creation. If you're using `Container Node Pool` resources with no default node pool, this should be set to true, alongside setting `Initial Node Count` to at least 1.

enable_private_nodes.description: Enables the private cluster feature, creating a private endpoint on the cluster. In a private cluster, nodes only have RFC 1918 private addresses and communicate with the master's private endpoint via private networking.

http_load_balancing.description: The status of the HTTP (L7) load balancing controller addon, which makes it easy to set up HTTP load balancers for services in a cluster.

oauth_scopes.description: List of scopes to apply to the default node pool. If `Remove Default Node Pool` is set to true, these values will not be used.
